description: Number of prime pairs {p,q}, such that pq < n^2.
comments: Number of semiprimes (A001358) < n^2. [_Michel Marcus_, Sep 02 2013]
example: a(3)=2 because only the prime pairs (2,2) and (2,3) form products < 9.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {sqn = n^2; idp = primepi(sqn\2); nbp = 0; for (i = 1, idp, p = prime(i); for (j = 1, i, if (p * prime(j) < sqn, nbp++););); nbp;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 02 2013
author: Joe K. Crump (joecr(AT)carolina.rr.com)
